REVISIONS_TO_PREVIOUSLY_PUBLISHED_DATA: Noteable revisions and changes to series in this publication are documented in the table below, beside the release when the revision first occurred.

UNNAMED:_4: Revision note

The Ministry reviewed its classification of energy use (covering both end-use and use for cogeneration) in the wood, pulp, and paper sectors to ensure its alignment with the International Energy Agency’s reporting framework. This resulted in the discovery that black liquor use should be classified as cogeneration use rather than end-use as it feeds into cogeneration systems as pulp mills.
